Name: Schaum's 3,000 Solved Problems in Physics (Schaum's Outline Series)

ReviewList.Text: The problems aren't as hard as the 2-star problems in engineering physics textbooks such as Giancoli's Physics for Engineers and Scientists. The problems in Schaum's probably are like the 1-star problems. After buying this, I bought the right books with challenging problems: The Portable T.A. (volumes 1 and 2) by Andrew Elby. It's no longer in print but you can buy used ones on any online bookstores or ebay.

The problems in here worked well with my text and class. The solutions concisely put me on the right track and set me on really manipulating the equations and eventually getting to that "aha" moment. The book includes tracks- a little guide to which problems you should work depending on your class (ex. easy, hard, calc-based). I used those and they cover your bases! Lots of practice, and time efficient studying. Couldn't recommend more.

For college physics, if you have the time to do all the probs, its a pretty good book. I noticed that its the same problems and explanations as the older version that is strangely more expensive...so...get at it guys...lol. But if you want really good, excellent, challenging, college level that will make you a master, I recommend Serway's physics problems to do, and...resnick,halliday's,and krane's physics book to learn from.

If physics hits you like a wall (in a vacuum, on a friction-less slope, at 30 degrees), then this is the book for you. It is very helpful when studying for exams, as the topics are clearly stated by section and can be easily matched with concepts from the text or homework problems.

I'm personally using this book to prepare for the USA Physics Olympiad, but if you are taking high school physics, any AP physics, or college physics this book is perfect. it provides very good explanations and walkthroughs and tons of practice problems with solutions. it really teaches you how to approach doing these problems, and not just memorizing equations, and I think that's what makes it so great. would recommend to anyone taking physics, or preparing to take physics.

First of all, I don't think there's anyone who actually went through every problem in this book and solved it. The amount of problems and work necessary to finish them would exhaust even the freest of schedules. Yet, there are some classics here, and if you focus on the problems that are coming up again and again in your course and apply techniques used to solve it presented in this book, you'll be fine. What else can I say, Schaum's Solved Problems rock!

I find the Schuam's books are very handy for the courses I take. I love this book! This book is a must for physics. It has over prepared me for exams, lol. I got a couple of 100's on the exam. There are so many examples for each topic covered, and explanations, which makes the concepts so clear.  Did I mention that I love this book! This is definitely a keeper. It helps for those of you tha have sucky teachers and tutors.

This book is great for help with physics because it not only has practice problems for you to practice in the book but it also goes through a bunch of different styles of problems step by step and shows you how to solve the problem. I would recommend this book for anyone who wants extra help with any calculus or non-calculus based physics class

This was a great supplement for learning early level physics. There are a variety of questions ranging from concept to calculus. It has been really helpful for my students, but be careful learning from the solutions. There are a few that are incorrect or misprinted.
Great homework aid.  Sometimes you will find your exact problem there. or something close that will get you started.  Hope I can spend the time and do many of the problems.
Worth every penny. Some of the answers could have a bit more detail, but overall excellent.
Solving problems is the best way to learn Physics so this book has been very helpful!

The guide has help me to figure out what to do with the equations given in physics. The equations are easy to remember but difficult to pull out if the written questions on most exams. This book gives a good overall view of the ways professors will present the problems annd makes it easier pick out similarities.
Excellent aid to someone studying physics.
Book, have fun
as described

haven't reviewed the book in detail yet, but any student taking physics will be benefited by having a resource for worked problems.  just hope that there are no (or very few) errors in the solutions.  (I have already found one answer that is wrong) - this wasn't a problem for me as I have a strong physics background, but for someone just learning the material, a wrong answer can really deflate their interest in continuing.
Excellent
excellent
Excellent

Definitely recommend this for Physics I students.  It's good practice for all the basic concepts that will be covered on exams and has very helpful explanations.  Perfect supplement to my recommended textbook.
I'm a freshman collage student who has returned to school after nearly 20 years. These books have made all the difference in my physics and calculus classes.
good
Comprehensive. Great way to get the hang of problems. Tackles the majority of topics found in an introductory college physics course.
Usefull
very good thank you so much. amazon company the great company and I find very interesting book in this company
Great, I like it, it is brand new and a lot of the topics are relevant to what my daughter is doing in school
Not exactly what I was hoping for. Does not walk me through the examples. Not very helpful in my opinion.
Did not help with general physics homework. Very disappointed, I wish I did not purchase this. It wasn't expensive but it's that's money I could've saved. :(
I just got it and opened it up.  its looks awesome i havnt used it yet but the solved problems look very nice.
